Spacetime or space+time?

Relativity theories try to tell us that space and time are not that different. They are relative: they depend on how an observer measures them. General relativity shows that our universe is made of tangled fabric: spacetime. But we, humans, perceive spacetime as space (three dimensional) and time (flowing in one direction). Can we find a way to write spacetime = space+time? In my Masters, I worked on a thesis about two methods to decompose spacetime to space and time. Since our world has 4 dimensions, there are two possible ways:

$$4 = 1 + 3 = 3 + 1$$

Well, of course these are not usual number. «3+1» means that you look at all points (3) at a specific moment of time (1). «1+3» means you follow paths of particles during all times.

At the end, none of these are better than the other but 1+3 is more interesting since it leads to a set of equations similar to Maxwell’s equations in Electromagnetism, so called Gravitoelectromagnetic.
